channel.title: Comments on: There Was a Spider in my Bathroom

item.title: By: Russell Heimlich » Blog Archive » Tips For Macro Bug Photography
item.dc:creator: Russell Heimlich » Blog Archive » Tips For Macro Bug Photography
item.description: [...] tips would have come in handy back when I was shooting the spider in my bathroom. Well, a macro lens would have helped [...]
item.content:encoded: […] tips would have come in handy back when I was shooting the spider in my bathroom. Well, a macro lens would have helped […]

item.title: By: Greg
item.dc:creator: Greg
item.description:
Do you know what kind it was? It looks kinda like a brown recluse. But I think the legs are too long. A sure fire way of telling if it has a violin shape on its head. http://www.cirrusimage.com/Arachnid/brown_recluse_spider.jpg
The bodies sometime vary in size and girth, but always has the violin. Nasty little suckers.
item.content:encoded:
Do you know what kind it was? It looks kinda like a brown recluse. But I think the legs are too long. A sure fire way of telling if it has a violin shape on its head. http://www.cirrusimage.com/Ara.....spider.jpg

The bodies sometime vary in size and girth, but always has the violin. Nasty little suckers.

item.title: By: Paulo
item.dc:creator: Paulo
item.description: Spiders are actually good to keep around indoors, since they eat flies and mosquitoes and other insects.
item.content:encoded: Spiders are actually good to keep around indoors, since they eat flies and mosquitoes and other insects.
